question.text: The family containing mustard and its main characters are

options.text: Brassicaceae - Tetramerous flowers, six stamens, bicarpellary gynoecium, siliqua type fruit
Brassicaceae - Pentamerous flowers, many stamens, pentacarpellary gynoecium, capsule type fruit
Solanaceae - Pentamerous flowers, five stamens, bicarpellary gynoecium, berry type fruit
Liliaceae - Actinomorphic flowers, six stamens, tricarpellary gynoecium, capsule type of fruit

solution.text: Mustard (Brassica campestris) is a member of Brassicaceae family which consists of tetramerous flower having tetradynamous stamens (2 + 4), bicarpellary syncarpous gynoecium with false septum called replum and the fruit is siliqua.
